We analyzed the impact of varying correlation on bivariate return periods using simulated data. We simulated four times 100 samples from a Frank copula with θ = 0, 1.9, 4.4, and 12 with uniform marginals. This resulted in correlation coefficients of approximately 0, 0.3, 0.6, and 0.9, respectively (note that θ = 0 corresponds to the independent copula).
